  • Constructor Details

    • TicTacToeWS

      public TicTacToeWS()
      Web Service constructor

  • Method Details

    • login

      public int login(String username, String password)
      Used to login to the system
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the user logging in.
      password - the password of the user logging in.
      Returns:
      either 0 if incorrect details, an integer greater than 0 (which is the users id) if correct details, -1 if there is a general error.

    • register

      public String register(String username, String password, String name, String surname)
      Used to register a new user on the system.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the new user.
      password - the password of the new user.
      name - - the name of the new user.
      surname - the surname of the new user.
      Returns:
      The user provides their username, password, name and surname. If successful, the method returns the users id on the system (the autokey field from the users table). If unsuccessful, it returns either “ERROR-REPEAT” if a user with that username already exists, “ERROR-INSERT” if the method could not add the data to the users table, “ERROR-RETRIEVE “ if the method cannot retrieve the newly inserted data from the users table, or “ERROR-DB” if the method cannot find the DB.

    • newGame

      public String newGame(int uid)
      Used to create a new game.
      Parameters:
      uid - the user id of the user creating the new game.
      Returns:
      either the id of the new game (returned as a string), or "ERROR-NOTFOUND", "ERROR-RETRIEVE", or "ERROR-INSERT" if the game couldn't be created, or "ERROR-DB" if unable to talk to the DB or DBMS.

    • joinGame

      public String joinGame(int uid, int gid)
      Used to join an existing game.
      Parameters:
      uid - the user id of the person joining the game.
      gid - the game id of the game the player wants to join.
      Returns:
      1 (as a string) if able to join, 0 (as a string) if unable to join, or "ERROR-DB" if unable to talk to the DB or DBMS.

    • getBoard

      public String getBoard(int gid)
      Returns the current board as a formatted string.
      Parameters:
      gid - the game id of the game whose board we want to see.
      Returns:
      Used to return all moves taken to date for a particular game. If successful, the method returns the moves taken as a string as follows {pId, x, y} for each row, each row separated by \n. The moves are returned in order of play (i.e. first move will be first row returned etc.). Using this we can evaluate how many moves have been taken (i.e. the number of rows), the last player to take a move (pId of the final row), plus all the moves taken to date. The method returns "ERROR-NOMOVES" if no moves have yet been made for that game, or "ERROR-DB" if unable to talk to the DB or DBMS.

    • getGameState

      public String getGameState(int gid)
      Returns the state of the game.
      Parameters:
      gid - the game id of the game whose state we wish to check.
      Returns:
      -1 (as a string) if waiting for a second player to join, 0 (as a string) if the game is in progress, 1 (as a string) if player 1 has won, 2 (as a string) if player 2 has won, 3 (as a string) if a draw, or "ERROR-NOGAME" if a game matching the game id cannot be found, or "ERROR-DB" if unable to talk to the DB or DBMS.

    • setGameState

      public String setGameState(int gid, int gstate)
      Sets the state of a game.
      Parameters:
      gid - the game id of the game whose state we wish to set.
      gstate - the state we wish to set the game to.
      Returns:
      1 (as a string) if successful, "ERROR-NOGAME" if unable to find a game matching gid, "ERROR-DB" if unable to talk the the DB or DBMS.

    • checkSquare

      public String checkSquare(int x, int y, int gid)
      Checks a particular square in a game to see if it has been or can be taken.
      Parameters:
      x - the columns position of the square.
      y - the row position of the square.
      gid - the game we are playing/checking.
      Returns:
      1 (as a string) if the square is taken, 0 (as a string) if the square is available, "ERROR-DB" if there is a problem talking to the DB or DBMS.

    • takeSquare

      public String takeSquare(int x, int y, int gid, int pid)
      Takes a square in a particular game for a particular player.
      Parameters:
      x - the column position of the square.
      y - the row position of the square.
      gid - the game we are playing.
      pid - the user id of the player taking the square.
      Returns:
      1 (as a string) if successful, 0 (as a string) if unsuccessful, "ERROR-TAKEN" if the square is unavailable, "ERROR-DB" if there is a problem talking to the DB or DBMS, "ERROR" if there is a general error.

    • checkWin

      public String checkWin(int gid)
      Used to see if the game is over or not, and who has won if it is over.
      Parameters:
      gid - the game id of the game we are checking.
      Returns:
      0 (as a string) if the game hasn’t been won but can continue to be played, 1 (as a string) if player 1 has won, 2 (as a string) if player 2 has won, or 3 (as a string) if the game is a draw. The method will return “ERROR-RETRIEVE” if there is an issue getting details about the game, “ERROR-NOGAME” if no game can be found matching the gid, “ERROR-DB” if there is a problem accessing the DB or DBMS.

    • deleteGame

      public String deleteGame(int gid, int uid)
      Used to remove un-started games from the DB.
      Parameters:
      gid - the game id of the game you wish to remove.
      uid - the user id of the person making the request (can only delete games you created).
      Returns:
      If the game has already started or the user is not the creator of the game, the method returns “ERROR-GAMESTARTED”, otherwise it returns 1 (as a string). The method returns “ERROR-DB” if it cannot access the DBMS.

    • showMyOpenGames

      public String showMyOpenGames(int uid)
      Used to show games you have created but that have not yet started.
      Parameters:
      uid - the user id of the player making the request.
      Returns:
      If the method is successful it returns a string as follows {{g.autokey, u.username, g.started}\n}*. If unsuccessful, the method returns “ERROR-NOGAMES” if it can find no games, or “ERROR-DB” if it cannot access the DBMS.

    • showAllMyGames

      public String showAllMyGames(int uid)
      Retrieves all games the user has played/is playing.
      Parameters:
      uid - the user id of the player making the request.
      Returns:
      If successful it returns a string as follows {{g.autokey, h.username, o.username, g.started}\n}*. h.username and o.username are the usernames of player 1 and player 2 respectively. If unsuccessful, the method returns “ERROR-NOGAMES” if it can find no games, or “ERROR-DB” if it cannot access the DBMS.

    • leagueTable

      public String leagueTable()
      Used to generate the content for a league table.
      Returns:
      If successful it returns a string as follows {{g.autokey, h.username, o.username, g.gamestate, g.started}\n}*. h.username and o.username are the usernames of player 1 and player 2 respectively. If unsuccessful, the method returns “ERROR-NOGAMES” if it can find no games, or “ERROR-DB” if it cannot access the DBMS.

    • showOpenGames

      public String showOpenGames()
      The list of open games (those with a p1 but no p2).
      Returns:
      If successful it returns a string as follows {{g.autokey, h.username, g.started}\n}*. h.username is the usernames of the player who started the game. If unsuccessful, the method returns “ERROR-NOGAMES” if it can find no games, or “ERROR-DB” if it cannot access the DBMS.

    • closeConnection

      public void closeConnection()
      Closes the connection to the database (before exiting the application).
